summary: PWA /app route bug fix verification complete. All tests passed: manifest.json has start_url: '/app', accessing /app without session shows login, accessing /app with session shows dashboard and cleans URL to '/', session persists in localStorage (mm_auth_token, mm_auth_user) across page reloads.
critical_code_review_comments: ✅ App.js detects /app route and shows login if not authenticated
✅ App.js shows dashboard (MindMapApp) when authenticated on /app route
✅ App.js cleans URL from /app to / when user is authenticated
✅ AuthContext.js persists session in localStorage with keys mm_auth_token and mm_auth_user
✅ Session persists across page reloads - user stays logged in
✅ PWA standalone mode detection works correctly

test_1_app_route_no_session.description: Accessing /app without session shows login form

test_2_login_stores_session.description: After login, mm_auth_token and mm_auth_user are stored in localStorage

test_3_session_persistence.description: Session persists in localStorage after page reload - user stays logged in

test_4_url_cleaning.description: When accessing /app with active session, URL is cleaned to / and dashboard is shown

context_for_next_testing_agent: PWA /app route bug has been fixed and verified. The flow works as expected: 1) PWA opens to /app, 2) If no session → login shown, 3) After login → dashboard shown and URL cleaned to /, 4) Session persists in localStorage across reloads. Test user: testuser123/password123
